intro: Thermopsis grubovii, commonly known as the yellow rocket, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other related species. The plant features bright yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branched. Thermopsis grubovii is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, high-altitude environments.
